pull.title: bloom: use Span instead of std::vector for `insert` and `contains`
pull.body:
This is #18985 rebased, with the most recent comments addressed.

> We can avoid many unnecessary std::vector allocations by changing
CBloomFilter to take Spans instead of std::vector's for the `insert`
and `contains` operations.

> CBloomFilter currently converts types such as CDataStream and uint256
to std::vector on `insert` and `contains`. This is unnecessary because
CDataStreams and uint256 are already std::vectors internally. We just
need a way to point to the right data within those types. Span gives
us this ability.

rename.from: bloom: use Span instead of std::vector for `insert` and `contains` (#18985)
rename.to: bloom: use Span instead of std::vector for `insert` and `contains`

events.body: Thanks for picking this up. Concept ACK.

verification.payload:
tree 6be2168585922040490ea0b56f982de1bf40cf6b
parent 3c776fdcec176ffaa2056633fa2b4e737cda29ce
author William Casarin <jb55@jb55.com> 1588388623 -0700
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1632879610 +0800

bloom: use Span instead of std::vector for `insert` and `contains`

We can avoid many unnecessary std::vector allocations by changing
CBloomFilter to take Spans instead of std::vector's for the `insert`
and `contains` operations.

CBloomFilter currently converts types such as CDataStream and uint256
to std::vector on `insert` and `contains`. This is unnecessary because
CDataStreams and uint256 are already std::vectors internally. We just
need a way to point to the right data within those types. Span gives
us this ability.

Signed-off-by: William Casarin <jb55@jb55.com>

events.message:
bloom: use Span instead of std::vector for `insert` and `contains`

We can avoid many unnecessary std::vector allocations by changing
CBloomFilter to take Spans instead of std::vector's for the `insert`
and `contains` operations.

CBloomFilter currently converts types such as CDataStream and uint256
to std::vector on `insert` and `contains`. This is unnecessary because
CDataStreams and uint256 are already std::vectors internally. We just
need a way to point to the right data within those types. Span gives
us this ability.

Signed-off-by: William Casarin <jb55@jb55.com>

comments.body: You could completely remove the `void insert(const uint256& hash);` and `bool contains(const uint256& hash) const;` methods in both `CRollingBloomFilter` and `CBloomFilter`, uint256 can be converted to Span automatically
Thought I'd done this in my branch already. Fixed.
